recommender

Class FunkSVDRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • recommender.BaseRecommender
      • recommender.FunkSVDRecommender

  • public class FunkSVDRecommender
extends BaseRecommender
    The Funk SVD recommender algorithm, as described by Simon Funk for the Netflix Prize Challenge.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FunkSVDRecommender

        public FunkSVDRecommender(DAO dao,
                  int NUM_FEATURES,
                  int MIN_ITER,
                  double INIT,
                  double MIN_IMPROVEMENT,
                  double ALPHA,
                  double BETA,
                  java.lang.String userFeaturesFile,
                  java.lang.String itemFeaturesFile)
        This constructor should be used when user preferences and item characteristics in terms of features are not known and require to be learned over the training data set.
        Parameters:
        dao - The Data Access Object providing access to the training and test data set.
        NUM_FEATURES - The number of features to represent the user tastes and movie attributes. A value between 30-50 is good enough. Increases this value improves the recommender accuracy but slows it down.
        MIN_ITER - The minimum number of iterations for which each feature should be trained. A value of 100-200 is good enough. Increases this value improves the recommender accuracy but slows it down.
        INIT - The initial value with which the matrices representing user tastes and movie attributes are initialized. Typically a value of 0.1 is used.
        MIN_IMPROVEMENT - The minimum improvement in RMSE so that next iteration is attempted. Training of each feature continues at least MIN_ITER times or while improvement in RMSE is greater than MIN_IMPROVEMENT. A value of 0.0001 is good enough.
        ALPHA - The learning rate. It controls the step size or the amount of feature adjustment at each iteration. A value of 0.001 is good enough. A large learning rate will speed up the learning process but might not converge. A small learning rate will slow down the learning process.
        BETA - The regularization parameter. It helps to smooth out the variations in the learning process. A value of 0.015 is good enough.
        userFeaturesFile - File name where matrix representing user preferences U[NUM_FEATURES x NUM_USERS] is to be stored. These features can be used for recommendation later.
        itemFeaturesFile - File name where matrix representing item characteristics V[NUM_FEATURES x NUM_ITEMS] is to be stored. These features can be used for recommendation later.

      • FunkSVDRecommender

        public FunkSVDRecommender(DAO dao,
                  java.lang.String userFeaturesFile,
                  java.lang.String itemFeaturesFile)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This constructor should be used when user preferences and item characteristics are known in terms of features and predictions need to be generated for users.
        Parameters:
        dao - The Data Access Object built on top of the training and test data set.
        userFeaturesFile - File name where matrix representing user preferences U[NUM_FEATURES x NUM_USERS] is stored. These features are used for recommendation.
        itemFeaturesFile - File name where matrix representing item characteristics V[NUM_FEATURES x NUM_ITEMS] is stored. These features are used for recommendation.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the feature files cannot be opened
        java.io.IOException - if any error occurs during reading the files
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the feature files have improper format

    • Method Detail

      • computeAvgs

        private void computeAvgs()
        Computes pseudo user average rating for each user, pseudo item average rating for each item and global average rating over all ratings.

      • dotProduct

        private double dotProduct(int user,
                int item)
        Returns:
        the dot product over feature vector of @user with feature vector of @item

      • predict

        public double predict(int user,
             int item)
        This method overrides the predict() method in the BaseRecommender class.
        Overrides:
        predict in class BaseRecommender
        Returns:
        the predicted rating that @user will assign to @item, or Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY if a prediction cannot be made

      • train

        public void train()
        This method overrides the train() method in the BaseRecommender class, learns user preferences and item characteristics in terms of features and writes out the learned features to userFeaturesFileName and itemFeaturesFileName. It can cause an exception if the files cannot be opened for writing.
        Overrides:
        train in class BaseRecommender
